name: 중앙관제 설비공사
contents: 1. 일반사항1.1 적용범위(1) 중앙 관제 설비인 중앙 제어 및 감시 장치, 현장 제어 장치(DDC 또는 PLC), 입출력 모듈(I/O module) 및 현장 검출/조작기기, 네트워크 구성상 필요에 따라 허브, 리피터, 라우터 등의 보조 장치 등에 적용한다.(2) 중앙 제어 및 감시 장치는 공기조화설비 등에 관련된 운전 및 자동제어에 관한 종합적인 관리를 행하는 것으로 자동제어설비공사 중 중앙관제설비에 적용한다.(3) 관제 대상내용, 원격 입출력 장치별 입출력표, 시스템 동작설명서 등은 설계도면 및 해당 공사의 공사시방서에 따른다.1.2 참고기준해당사항 없음1.3 용어의 정의기준의 용어 정의는 KCS 31 10 10(1.3) 을 참조한다.1.4 시스템 구성(1) 중앙 관제 설비는 중앙 제어 및 감시 장치 조작터미널, 기록장치, 상시 표시장치, 무정전 전원장치, 통신 제어장치, 현장 제어장치, 입출력 모듈, 그리고 현장 검출/조작기기와 구동 소프트웨어 로 이루어지며, 각 장치에 대한 시스템의 구성은 해당 공사의 공사시방서에 따른다.(2) 빌딩 자동제어 및 제어통신망은 개방형 프로토콜 및 표준 프로토콜인 BACnet, MODBUS, TCP/IP 등을 적용한다.  1.5 기능1.5.1 운용자 암호 지정 및 운용 등급 지정각 운용자별로 암호 및 다양한 감시 등급을 지정하여 오조작에 의한 중요한 파일 등의 손실 및 비인가된 외부인의 임의 조작을 방지할 수 있도록 한다.1.5.2 메뉴 방식의 운용모든 시스템의 운용 방식을 메뉴 선택 방식으로 구성하여 마우스, 기능키 및 화면터치로편리하게 작업 모드를 전환하고 관제점 제어 기능이 가능하도록 한다.1.5.3 원격 기동/정지각종 펌프, 송풍기, 열원 장치 등 동력 기기의 기동/정지를 원거리에서 자동 또는 수동으로 조작한다.1.5.4 상태 감시원격 또는 현장에서 자동 및 수동으로, 직접 또는 연동하여 기동/정지되는 각종 펌프, 송풍기, 열원장치 등 동력기기의 기동/정지 상태를 상시 또는 필요시에 표시 또는 기록하고, 저장한다.1.5.5 경보 감시각종 펌프, 송풍기, 열원 장치 등 동력기기의 고장을 발견하고, 현장에서 검출되는 온습도, 압력, 액면 높이 등의 이상 상태를 수신하며, 계측한 온습도 등의 상, 하한 이상을 판단하여 표시, 경보 및 기록한다. 화면상에 고장이 발생한 지점의 고유 번호가 자동적으로 표시되며 곧바로 고장 장비와 관련된 그래픽 화면이 표시되고 경보 등급에 따른 자동조치 사항을 수행과 동시에 프린터에서 경보 상태 등을 자동으로 출력한다. 1.5.6 계측온도, 습도, 기타 아날로그 값을 계측하고 표시 및 기록하며, 경우에 따라서는 제어, 연   산, 기억시킨다.1.5.7 스케줄 운전사용 전에 등록된 운전 스케줄에 따라 동력기기의 기동/정지를 원거리에서 자동적으로 행한다. 스케줄은 요일, 휴일에 따라 여러 개의 모드 설정이 가능하며, 1일 여러 번의 기동/정지가 가능하고, 필요에 따라서 기동/정지의 실행을 기록할 수 있어야 한다.1.5.8 온습도 제어의 설정현장에 설치된 온습도 조절기의 설정값을 원거리에서 설정하고, 여름, 겨울, 중간기의 전환 설정이 될 수 있는 것으로 한다.1.5.9 공기조화에 관한 에너지 제어각 공기조화설비 계통별로 최적 기동/정지 제어, 절전 운전제어, 외기도입제어, 대수제어, 교번 운전제어, 설정값 스케줄 제어 등을 할 수 있도록 한다.1.5.10 운전관리에 관한 자료수집운전시간의 적산, 소비 에너지의 연산 및 적산 등 공기조화설비의 운전관리에 관한 자료를 수집하고, 기억, 표시, 기록할 수 있도록 한다.1.5.11 보고서보고서는 자체 운영 프로그램에서 보고서 작성 기능을 제공하거나 운영 시스템의 패키지 프로그램을 통해서 제공한다.1.5.12 기타설비의 제어, 계측 및 기록전기설비, 방재, 방범설비, 기타 관련 설비의 제어, 계측 및 기록은 해당 공사의 공사시방서에 따른다.1.5.13 시설물 관리 기능시스템에서 자동적으로 수집된 데이터와 수작업으로 입력한 데이터에 따라 데이터베이스를 구축하고, 이것을 적절히 활용하여 건물의 유지관리 및 환경을 분석하고, 진단정보를 제공하는 것으로 한다. 이에 대한 상세한 기능은 해당 공사의 공사시방서에 따르며, 중앙관제 설비 중 설계도서에 해당 항목이 있을 경우 적용한다.1.5.14 원격 감시설계도서에 해당항목이 있을 경우 인터넷 전용선, 또는 일반 전화망 및 이동통신망을 통한 원격 감시 및 관리가 가능한 시스템을 적용한다.1.6 제출물1.6.1 제출 도서다음과 같은 자동제어설비 관련 도서를 제출한다.(1) 시스템 설명서(계통도 및 작동순서도 포함)(2) 관제점 일람표(3) 자동제어 기기 규격서(4) 중앙감시반 외형도 (감시반 그래픽 포함)(5) 현장 제어반 외형도(6) 기기 카탈로그(7) 제어기기간 결선도(8) 주요 구성기기의 호환 또는 대체품 목록(센서류, 유량계, 제어밸브, 수위제어기 등)1.6.2 시공 상세도면현장 여건을 감안하여 각종 제어기기의 실제 위치 등을 발주도면의 범례에 따라 작성 . 제출토록 한다.1.6.3 운전관리자 교육용 제출물시운전 전까지 아래의 교육 및 운용을 위한 자료를 제출토록 한다.(1) 기기취급 요령서(2) 고장수리 및 진단법(3) 사후 유지관리 지침1.7 품질보증공사계약서에서 정하는 하자보수 보증기간 내에 자동제어 시스템의 정상동작 및 운영 하에서 발생한 하자에 대하여 수급인은 무상으로 기기를 조정, 수리 또는 교체한다.1.8 시공 전 협의자동제어 전력공급과 원격제어용 동력제어반 단자대 사용 및 공동구 관로 가대 사용에 대하여는 전기 수급인과 사전 협의하여 시공에 차질이 없도록 한다.1.9 운반, 보관 및 취급(1) 자동제어 기기류는 공장에서 포장한 상태로, 각종 제어반은 보호커버를 설치한 상태로 반입한다.(2) 포장이나 보호커버는 설치고정 장소로 반입 후에 해체토록 한다.2. 자재2.1 중앙감시반2.1.1 주 컴퓨터 장치주 컴퓨터 장치의 하드웨어, 소프트웨어, 주변기기들은 신뢰성이 검증된 최신의 버전을 설치하는 것으로 한다.(1) 하드웨어① CPU가. 3.2Ghz 이상나. 주기억장치 4 G Byte 이상② 전원: 220 V, 60 Hz③ 그래픽카드: 해상도 1280×1024 이상 지원④ 보조기억장치가. 하드디스크 용량 : 500 GB 이상나. 1. General Provisions 1.1 Scope of Application (1) This applies to central control equipment, including central control and monitoring devices, field control devices (DDC or PLC), input/output modules (I/O module), field detection/actuation devices, and auxiliary devices such as hubs, repeaters, and routers as needed for network configuration. (2) Central control and monitoring devices perform comprehensive management of operation and automatic control related to HVAC systems, etc., and are applied to central control equipment within automatic control equipment construction projects. (3) Control items, input/output tables for remote input/output devices, system operation manuals, etc., shall be in accordance with design drawings and the specifications for the relevant construction. 1.2 Reference Standards - Not applicable "1.3 Definitions of Terms - Definitions of terms are based on KCS 31 10 10(" Please refer to 1.3). 1.4 System Configuration (1) The central control facility consists of a central control and monitoring device operation terminal, a recording device, a permanent display device, an uninterruptible power supply (UPS), a communication control device, a field control device, input/output modules, and field detection/actuation devices and driving software. The configuration of each device within the system shall be in accordance with the specifications of the relevant construction project. (2) The building automation and control communication network shall adopt open and standard protocols such as BACnet, MODBUS, and TCP/IP. 1.5 기능 1. Assign passwords and operational levels to each operator, and designate various monitoring levels to prevent loss of important files, etc., due to erroneous operation and unauthorized manipulation by external individuals. 1. "5.2 Menu-based Operation: The operation of all systems is configured with a menu selection system, allowing users to conveniently switch between work modes and control the control point functions using a mouse, function keys, and screen touch." 1. 5.3 Remote start/stop of various pumps, blowers, heat sources, and other power devices can be operated remotely, automatically or manually. 1. Continuously or as needed, the status of starting/stopping various power devices such as pumps, blowers, heat sources, etc., which are started/stopped automatically or manually, directly or in conjunction, remotely or on-site, is displayed, recorded, and stored. 1. It detects failures of various power devices such as pumps, blowers, and heat sources, receives abnormal conditions detected on-site such as temperature, humidity, pressure, and liquid level, determines upper and lower limit abnormalities of measured temperature and humidity, and displays, alarms, and records them. The unique number of the point where a failure occurred is automatically displayed on the screen, and a graphic screen related to the faulty equipment is immediately displayed. It performs automatic actions according to the alarm level and simultaneously automatically prints alarm status and other information from the printer. 1. "5.6 Measures temperature, humidity, and other analog values, displays and records them, and, as needed, controls, performs calculations, and stores data." 1. Prior to using scheduled operation, the system automatically performs start/stop operations of power equipment remotely, based on the registered operation schedule. The schedule allows for multiple mode settings based on days of the week and holidays, enables multiple start/stop operations per day, and should be capable of recording the execution of start/stop operations as needed. 1. The temperature and humidity controller installed at the setting site of 5.8 temperature and humidity control shall be remotely configurable, and capable of switching between summer, winter, and intermediate settings. 1. The system shall enable optimal start/stop control, power-saving operation control, outdoor air intake control, cascade control, alternating operation control, and setpoint schedule control for each system of the energy control section related to air conditioning. 1. Collects data related to HVAC system operation management, including accumulating and calculating operating hours and energy consumption, and enables storage, display, and recording. 1. The 5.11 report provides report generation functionality either through its own operating program or through packaged programs within the operating system. 1. The control, instrumentation, and recording of electrical equipment for other facilities 5.12, fire-fighting facilities, security facilities, and the control, instrumentation, and recording of other related facilities shall comply with the specifications for the construction of the relevant project. 1. A database shall be established based on data automatically collected by the 5.13 Facility Management Functional System and data entered manually, and this database shall be utilized appropriately to analyze the building's maintenance and environment, and to provide diagnostic information. Detailed functions shall be in accordance with the construction specifications for the relevant project, and shall be applied if there is a corresponding item in the design documents for the central control equipment. 1. If the relevant item is included in the 5.14 remote monitoring design specifications, a system capable of remote monitoring and management via dedicated internet lines, or general telephone and mobile communication networks, shall be applied. Submission 1.6 1. Submit the following documents related to automatic control equipment as per section 6.1. (1) System Description (including process and operating flow diagrams) (2) List of Control Points (3) Specifications of Automatic Control Devices (4) Central Monitoring Panel Layout (including monitoring panel graphics) (5) Field Control Panel Layout (6) Equipment Catalogs (7) Interconnection Diagrams of Controllers (8) List of Compatible or Alternative Components for Major Components (sensors, flowmeters, control valves, level controllers, etc.) 1. Considering the on-site conditions, the actual locations of various control devices shall be drawn and submitted in accordance with the legend of the client's drawings. 1. Prior to the commissioning run, the following materials for training and operation of the 6.3 Operator Training Program Submission shall be submitted. (1) Equipment Operation Manual (2) Troubleshooting and Diagnostic Procedures (3) Post-Maintenance Guidelines The Contractor shall, without charge, adjust, repair, or replace the equipment for any defects arising from the normal operation of the automatic control system within the warranty period for defect repair as stipulated in the Quality Assurance Construction Contract 1.7. Prior to construction, coordination with the electrical contractor is required regarding the use of automatic power supply control, remote control power control panel terminal blocks, and common ductwork supports, to ensure smooth construction. 1.9 Transportation, Storage, and Handling (1) Automated control equipment shall be transported to the site in its factory packaging, and all control panels shall be transported with protective covers installed. (2) Packaging and protective covers shall be removed after arrival at the final installation location. 2. Materials Central Monitoring Team 2.1 2. 1.1 Main Computer DeviceThe hardware, software, and peripherals of the main computer device shall be installed with the latest versions that have been verified for reliability. (1) Hardware① CPU... 1. General Requirements
   1.1 System Requirements:
      - Processor: 3.2GHz or higher
      - Memory: 4GB or more
      ② Power: 220 V, 60 Hz
      ③ Graphics Card: Supports a resolution of 1280x1024 or higher
      ④ Auxiliary Storage: Hard disk capacity of 500 GB or more. USB memory connection. ODD: DVD recorder
      ⑤ I/O Ports: Mouse port, USB port, wired LAN port
   (2) Main Functions: As a central processing unit composed of software for central control and monitoring and memory, it should be capable of performing the functions of a computer with program processing, information exchange and processing within the processor, information collection and processing with peripheral devices of distributed processing units, and the performance mentioned in the software.
   (3) Functions of the Central Monitoring Panel Control Points: The control points shall be in accordance with the construction details, specifications, or construction specifications.
      ① Setting of control point fixed values/status
      ② Diagnosis and display of results of on-site control devices
      ③ Summary of a series of control points and summary of alarm points
      ④ Display and modification of digital control point status and analog control point values
      ⑤ Display and modification of time and date
      ⑥ Display and modification of DDC (or PLC) parameters
      ⑦ Display and modification of analog limit values
      ⑧ Display and modification of time schedules
      ⑨ Display and modification of operating time accumulation and operating time limit
      ⑩ Initialization sequence and diagnostic display of DDC (or PLC) control devices 2. 1.2 Distributed Processing Unit (1) The distributed processing unit acts as an intermediary between the main computer and field control devices and can be separated from or installed within the computer as needed. (2) It shall use BACnet, established as a building automation control and control communication network according to KS F ISO 1648-5, as the equipment’s default protocol, and shall support BACnet/IP connectivity and be a BTL (BACnet testing laboratories) certified product. 2. 1.3 Peripherals (1) Monitor ① Specifications: 24-inch or larger color TFT-LCD (TFT LCD with LED Backlight) ② Resolution: 1920×1080 or higher ③ Response Time: 5ms or less ④ Brightness: 300cd/㎡ or higher ⑤ Viewing Angle: 160° or more (left/right, up/down) ⑥ Contrast Ratio: 1000:1 or higher (2) Printer ① Laser-class (capable of printing A3/A4 sizes) (3) Intercom Device ① The main intercom unit shall have the function of communicating with the remote intercom unit via voice. ② All controls for intercom calls shall be performed by the main intercom unit. ③ The remote intercom unit shall be able to be called from the field to the central monitoring room and shall be available for free use at all times. (4) Portable Operation Terminal (POT) or Laptop Computer ① Overview: The operator shall be able to read system variable values embedded in the field control device, change control parameters, and operate them through the POT or laptop computer, and receive power and data by directly plugging them into each field control device. However, this shall be excluded if the POT or laptop computer can perform the same functions as the field control device panel. ② Functions a. Setting of fixed values/status of control points b. Diagnosis and display of field control device results c. Display of a series of control point summaries and alarm point summaries d. Display and modification of digital control point status and analog control point values e. Display and modification of date and time f. Display and modification of DDC (or PLC) parameters g. Display and modification of analog limit values h. Display and modification of time schedules i. Calculation and display of operating time accumulation and operating time limit j. Display and modification of field control device control device initialization sequence and diagnostic display 2.2 Field Control Devices (DDC or PLC) (1) The field control device shall incorporate basic energy-saving software with its own operating system (O.S: Operating System) to control each data item, and shall be comprised of a 16-bit or higher microprocessor with 8-hour capacitor or 16-hour battery-backed RAM for preserving data files and the field control device’s own DDC (or PLC) programs. (2) The real-time clock, backed up by the battery, shall display year, month, day, day of the week, and time. (3) The field control device (DDC or PLC) incorporating a microprocessor shall have power, A/D, D/A converters, memory, and communication functions, and shall be capable of controlling the total input equivalent to or greater than that of the main control point in the machine room. (4) The field control device shall be equipped with the following diagnostic LED indicators: ① Communication ② System Error (5) Communication between field control devices shall be possible without the control of the main computer device of the central monitoring station, and each field control device shall have independent functions that allow it to operate independently and execute energy-saving programs even in the event of communication failure. (6) Moisture-proof lighting shall be installed inside the control panel. (7) Surge and overcurrent protection circuits shall be incorporated. 2.3 Software 2. The software for the 3.1 central processing unit, computer devices, and distributed processing devices provides the following software: ① 2 copies of application programs stored on CD or USB ② 2 copies of the application program user manual. The user manual includes case-specific emergency response information for potential issues that may arise in the system and contact information for emergency assistance. (1) Operating program (O.S) (2) Application programs ① CRT monitoring panel operation screen configuration, central monitoring panel standard screen configuration, according to the design drawings. However, the screen configuration may be determined in consultation with the supervisor within the range in which the performance stipulated in the design drawings can be guaranteed according to the software characteristics of the contractor. ② Status monitoring function a. System point status, alarm monitoring b. Dynamic graphics function ③ System control function a. Schedule control function (weekdays, holidays, temporary days, specific days) b. Normal/Backup power processing function (sequential startup) c. Interlock control function (single interlock, composite interlock) d. Pump alternate control function e. Optimal startup/shutdown control function f. Multi-port function g. Alarm message setting function h. Application program function ④ Report function a. Trend function (output in text or graphics) b. Accumulation function (output in text or graphics) c. Report function (user selection) ⑤ System management function a. User management (password setting in stages according to user’s ability) b. Operation record management c. Alarm sound and alarm message management function d. Past data management e. Current system status storage ⑥ Auxiliary function Date and time change. 2. 3.2 Field Control Device Software The software for the field control device shall provide software that meets the automatic control requirements of this standard and shall have the following technical functions. (1) It shall be possible to select and use proportional control (P), proportional-integral control (PI), proportional-derivative control (PID), and adaptive control functions. (2) Alarm lock software shall be provided to prevent unnecessary alarms. The time shall be set so that alarms are generated after a certain period of time has elapsed after the air conditioner or equipment is started and stable conditions are reached. (3) Operating time shall be integrated based on the status of the digital input control point. (4) The field control device program shall satisfy the operation description specified in the drawings, etc. 3. Construction 3.1 General Provisions (1) Regarding the installation of control panels, devices, equipment, electrical conduits, and wiring, construction shall be carried out in consultation with the relevant work. (2) The spacing between control panels, devices, and equipment shall be sufficient to allow for operation and maintenance without hindrance, and they shall be arranged for easy operation and monitoring. (3) During the transportation and handling of control panels or devices, protect the outer casing and, conversely, take appropriate protective measures according to the size, weight, and contents of the control panel or device to prevent adverse effects on the internal components of the control panel, the device surface, and the equipment installed within the device. (4) If control panels or devices are installed and left unattended for an extended period before operation, take protective measures to prevent deterioration of function due to dust, moisture, or other factors. (5) The central monitoring panel shall be equipped with surge protection devices against lightning strikes. 3.2 Central Control and Monitoring Devices, Field Control Devices Installation 3. "2.1 Desktop deviceThe stand of the desktop device shall be stable and not wobble or tip over." 3. When structural steel is used as the base for self-supporting equipment (1), it must be installed with the top surface level and securely fastened to the floor with bolts. (2) Attach the control panel to the fixed base and adjust with liners or the like to prevent gaps between adjacent control panels, then secure with bolts. 3. 2.3 Wall-mounted Devices (1) Wall-mounted devices shall be installed using a method appropriate for their weight and installation location. (2) For those with significant weight or special installation requirements, installation details shall be submitted prior to construction. 3.3 Wiring (1) Electrical piping and wiring for automatic control shall comply with the relevant provisions of architectural electrical installation work, and when the design documents specify the use of special wires or cables, they shall be installed according to the construction methods specified by the manufacturers of these products. 3.4 Testing and Inspection (1) Prior to comprehensive adjustment, functional testing, inspection, and adjustment are performed on each device, control panel, and equipment unit by providing simulated input signals or actual inputs to ensure the required basic operation. (2) Comprehensive adjustment verifies that each device, control panel, and equipment unit organically integrates and satisfies the functions indicated in the design specifications. (3) If the specified conditions cannot be obtained during the adjustment stage, adjustments are made using methods such as simulated input/output, and when the specified conditions are obtained, fine adjustments and verification are performed. The same method applies to adjustments required in relation to other equipment. 3.5 Commissioning (1) Commissioning related to automatic control systems shall comply with this standard KCS 31 20 25. When performing the work, the contractor shall be familiar with the relevant content and perform the work accordingly. The contractor shall attend meetings chaired by the commissioning manager and provide necessary commissioning documents. In consultation with the commissioning manager, the contractor shall perform performance verification tests and operator training, and submit a report of the results. (2) The performance verification test is to demonstrate through actual operation that the automatic control work meets the contractual requirements, and shall be performed by the contractor in the presence of the commissioning manager. 3. Prior to the preliminary performance test and performance verification test, this site acceptance and commissioning test verifies that the control equipment components are properly installed and functioning. Submit a result report after confirming the following items. Provide detailed explanations for any missing or unverified items. (1) Verify the installation status of various control system components, wiring, and accessories. (2) Verify the voltage and grounding status of the control circuit. (3) Verify that various wires, components, and panels have appropriate markings. (4) Verify that various valves and actuators have been properly calibrated for zero and span adjustment. (5) Verify the completion of calibration for various sensor readings. (6) Verify the suitability of the control function of various safety devices. (7) Verify the status of all electrical interlocks. (8) Verify that various workstations, laptops, and operation-related controllers have been delivered and that system and database software has been installed. (9) Verify the completion status of the as-installed drawings and as-built drawings. (10) If necessary, verify the communication error status using a network and serial protocol analyzer. (11) Verify that the programs for all digital controllers have been backed up. (12) Verify the stand-alone operation function of each controller. (13) Verify the completion status of the as-installed drawings and as-built drawings. 3. 5.2 Performance Verification Test Plan (1) The contractor shall prepare and obtain approval for the performance verification test plan in consultation with the commissioning manager, considering the characteristics of the control system appropriate for the site. (2) This plan shall include clear test items to verify the test procedure for each component under test, expected response values, pass/fail criteria, and operation manuals. 3. 5.3 Performance Verification Test (1) Upon completion of the preliminary performance test, the performance verification test shall be performed in accordance with the performance verification test plan. (2) Coordinate with the Commissioning Manager to prepare the test schedule and notify relevant parties. (3) Personnel, equipment, measuring instruments, and materials required for the test shall be provided at the contractor’s expense. (4) If any failure items are found during the test, if there is sufficient time, resolve the issues and conduct a retest. If there is not enough time, reinvestigate and correct the defects and proceed with a retest later. (5) Record all issues and revisions. 3. Upon completion of the performance verification test, a completion report shall be submitted to the relevant parties. The report shall describe any issues encountered during the test execution and the corrective actions taken. 3. 5.5 Operation and Maintenance Manager Training Training for the Operation and Maintenance Manager shall be conducted regarding the operation of the control system installed in the site. The training instructor shall be selected from those who sufficiently understand and can explain the control system of the site. The training schedule shall be coordinated with the building owner or the operation and maintenance manager, and the training shall be conducted on-site during normal working hours as much as possible. Approved operation and maintenance manuals and as-built drawings shall be used as training materials, and they shall be provided to the trainees before the start of the training. (1) Training Plan At least 30 days prior to training, a training plan shall be submitted. The plan shall include the training date, purpose, summary of each training course, instructor’s resume, and qualifications. (2) Stage 1: Basic Training ① Basic network communication ② List of on-site control systems, control inspection, and purpose ③ Control equipment and network communication structure ④ On-site control sequence ⑤ Various alarm functions ⑥ Troubleshooting communication and hardware errors (3) Stage 2: Operation Training ① Mechanical and electrical systems and on-site control device components (controllers, valves, dampers, switches, temperature sensors, and various sensor types) ② Explanation of the function and components of each DDC panel ③ Finding, reading, and writing individual control devices for each operating interface ④ Downloading and modifying control programs ⑤ Creation, editing, and viewing of configured changes, trends, and alarm devices ⑥ Program and database storage and backup ⑦ Graphic material editing, background modification, and connection with other graphics ⑧ Alarm and event management ⑨ Removal and addition of network devices
